entries.title: Egypt hands out life sentences over 2019 protests
entries.description: An Egyptian court on Sunday handed down life prison sentences to 38 people, most of them tried in absentia, including a self-exiled businessman whose social media posts helped to spark anti-government protests.

entries.title: France's cyber defense force questions the role of US support in Europe
entries.description: Since the war in Ukraine, the United States has sent several specialized teams to help countries vulnerable to Russian cyber-attacks. France is concerned that it could open the way for broader espionage operations.

entries.title: Sexual abuse: 'The most extensive international investigations have only involved the Catholic Church'
entries.description: Is sexual abuse a specifically Catholic issue? While the former archbishop of Paris, Michel Aupetit, is being investigated for alleged sexual assault, historian Blandine Chelini-Pont analyzes the systemic dimension of the scandals that have hit the Church.

entries.title: Australian Open: Novak Djokovic, Iga Swiatek the Grand Slam favorites
entries.description: The Australian Open, the first Grand Slam of the season, begins Monday. Novak Djokovic, back after his expulsion from Australia, and Iga Swiatek, the world number 1, are the favorites.

entries.title: Latvia hit by worst flood in decades
entries.description: The mayor of the city of Jekabpils said the situation 'remained tense' despite deploying floating tanks and strengthening a dam.

entries.title: The budding traffic of cannabis 'gardeners'
entries.description: An increasing number of French citizens are growing their own weed and engaging in local trafficking.

entries.title: 'Ayatollah Khamenei's blind paranoia explains the ferocity of repression in Iran'
entries.description: The 83-year-old Supreme Leader of the Islamic Republic of Iran, who suffers from chronic bouts of depression, is obsessed with the prospect of his demise.

entries.title: Back to the big screen: Five movie theaters to visit in and around Paris
entries.description: Paris' independent movie theaters often offer more than movie screenings, including talks, guides, and interesting histories.

entries.title: German anti-coal protesters accuse police of violence
entries.description: Organizers said that 35,000 protesters demonstrated on Saturday. Police put the figure at 15,000.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: At least 21 killed in Dnipro after wave of Russian strikes
entries.description: At least 21 people were killed and 73 others wounded after a Russian missile struck a Dnipro tower block. Ukrainian President Zelensky pleaded for more western weapons.

entries.title: Protest-hit Peru declares state of emergency in Lima
entries.description: Supporters of ousted president Pedro Castillo have taken to the streets and blocked roads across Peru since December, demanding the removal of President Dina Boluarte, who has refused to step down.

entries.title: 'We don't want to become a theocracy': Over 80,000 Israeils protest against Netanyahu government legal reform
entries.description: Some 80,000 demonstrators gathered to protest the far-right Benyamin Netanyahu government's planned judiciary overhaul.

entries.title: Paris to hold referendum on e-scooter rental services
entries.description: Parisians will vote on whether or not to ban the 15,000 scooters operated by companies Lime, Dott and Tier in Paris on April 2.

entries.title: Storm-battered California gets more wind, rain and snow
entries.description: At least 19 people are known to have died from storm-related causes in the last three weeks.

entries.title: Nepal: Dozens killed in plane crash with 72 on board
entries.description: Seventy-two people, including 15 foreigners, were on board the plane when it crashed on Sunday morning.

entries.title: Louis Vuitton celebrates its bountiful art alliances from Miami to Paris
entries.description: Between its large-scale collaboration with Yayoi Kusama and its new exhibition venue in Paris, the world's number one luxury goods company continues to strengthen its relationships with visual artists.

entries.title: 'In the Sahel region, French officers operated with a colonial mindset'
entries.description: The fact that France keeps operating military bases in Africa is no longer acceptable for the continent's youth, journalist Rémy Carayol tells 'Le Monde'.

entries.title: French chlordecone case dismissed on a sour note
entries.description: The order of dismissal condemns the French authorities' inaction to control stocks after the pesticide was officially banned in Guadeloupe and Martinique in 1993.

entries.title: Under blockade, Armenians in Nagorno-Karabakh call for international help
entries.description: Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev, who controls the region, is advising residents to leave the enclave in the "blue helmet trucks" deployed by Moscow.

entries.title: Kevin McCarthy was elected speaker of the House. Does anyone care?
entries.description: During the night of January 6-7, after four days, three nights and 15 rounds of voting, the US Republicans finally elected Kevin McCarthy speaker of the House of Representatives. Their children will be able to go back to school.

entries.title: Ethiopia: Europe begins operation reconquest after peace in Tigray
entries.description: The French and German foreign ministers, Catherine Colonna and Annalena Baerbock, made an official visit to Addis Ababa on January 12 and 13.
